values.description:
vcpkg has updated the Ogre version to 1.11 and it broke several library paths

[Currently broken:](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign_rendering-ci-win/34/)

```
CMake Warning at D:/vcpkg/scripts/buildsystems/vcpkg.cmake:246 (_find_package):
  Found package configuration file:

    D:/vcpkg/installed/x64-windows/share/ogre/OGREConfig.cmake

  but it set OGRE_FOUND to FALSE so package "OGRE" is considered to be NOT
  FOUND.  Reason given by package:

  Component 'RenderSystem_GL' is required but was not found
```

With these changes:

![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ign_rendering-pr-win&build=310)
[https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/ign\_rendering-pr-win/310/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/ign_rendering-pr-win/310/))
values.title: Fixes for vcpkg ogre 1.11 version

values.description:
This PR enable the use of ogre2 code installed by a [custom vcpkg port](https://github.com/osrf/vcpkg-ports/blob/master/ogre2/portfile.cmake) hosted under osrf account.

Tested here:

![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ign_rendering-pr-win&build=334)
[https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign\_rendering-pr-win/334/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign_rendering-pr-win/334/))

This PR enable the use of ogre2 code installed by a [custom vcpkg port](https://github.com/osrf/vcpkg-ports/blob/master/ogre2/portfile.cmake) hosted under osrf account.

![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ign_rendering-pr-win&build=334)

values.description: It seems that sometimes protobuf only supports the old convention, so we should check for both cases for maximum version support.
values.title: Also check for PROTOBUF_FOUND

summary.raw: It seems that sometimes protobuf only supports the old convention, so we should check for both cases for maximum version support.
summary.html: It seems that sometimes protobuf only supports the old convention, so we should check for both cases for maximum version support.

values.description: OGRE2 has slightly modified the internal include path structure for Hlms to include a `Common` directory.  As a result, we need to add that include path to the corresponding components.
values.title: Fix include paths for new OGRE2 directory structure

summary.raw: OGRE2 has slightly modified the internal include path structure for Hlms to include a `Common` directory.  As a result, we need to add that include path to the corresponding components.
summary.html: OGRE2 has slightly modified the internal include path structure for Hlms to include a Common directory. As a result, we need to add that include path to the corresponding components.

values.description:
This PR does two things:

1. Turns on doxygen warnings.
2. Creates a script that can be used in CI (bitbucket pipelines for example) to check for doxygen warnings.

See: #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-math/pull-requests/324
values.title: Output warnings, and exclude detail directory.

See: #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-math/pull-requests/324
summary.html:
This PR does two things:

values.description:
I didn't realize the diamond next to function names was a link to the function definition.  Example [here](https://ignitionrobotics.org/api/math/6.2/classignition_1_1math_1_1Box.html#ab35f0568f1775ad9ae0b7c63c47f0362).

This PR changes the diamond to [material link icon](https://material.io/resources/icons/?icon=link&style=baseline).

There is no option in doxygen to change what it generates here, so I have to use javascript.
values.title: Change the diamond link icon to a material design link

summary.raw:
I didn't realize the diamond next to function names was a link to the function definition.  Example [here](https://ignitionrobotics.org/api/math/6.2/classignition_1_1math_1_1Box.html#ab35f0568f1775ad9ae0b7c63c47f0362).

This PR changes the diamond to [material link icon](https://material.io/resources/icons/?icon=link&style=baseline).

There is no option in doxygen to change what it generates here, so I have to use javascript.
summary.html:
I didn't realize the diamond next to function names was a link to the function definition. Example here.

This PR changes the diamond to material link icon.

There is no option in doxygen to change what it generates here, so I have to use javascript.

values.description:
Another fix to doxgyen.

The problem can be seen [here](https://ignitionrobotics.org/api/math/6.2/classignition_1_1math_1_1MassMatrix3.html#a4a4c9568f568e12531010bfcf4240ec3).

The `IGN_DEPRECATION` tags were not properly filtered by doxygen.
values.title: Fix doxygen deprecation filter

summary.raw:
Another fix to doxgyen.

The problem can be seen [here](https://ignitionrobotics.org/api/math/6.2/classignition_1_1math_1_1MassMatrix3.html#a4a4c9568f568e12531010bfcf4240ec3).

The `IGN_DEPRECATION` tags were not properly filtered by doxygen.
summary.html:
Another fix to doxgyen.

The problem can be seen here.

The IGN_DEPRECATION tags were not properly filtered by doxygen.

values.description:
Avoid hardcoding /machine:x64 flag on 64-bit on MSVC

On MSVC compilers with 64-bit, a /machine:x64 linker flag was manually added to workaround for http://www.cmake.org/Bug/print\_bug\_page.php?bug\_id=11240 . However, that CMake bug was fixed in CMake 3.4, and the minimum version of CMake required by ignition-cmake is 3.5.1, so the workaround can be safely removed. 

Furthermore, now MSVC also supports compiling for ARM64 architecture \(whose linker flag is /machine:ARM64\) so the workaround is currently preventing the compilation of ignition libraries for ARM64 architectures with Visual Studio.
values.title: Avoid hardcoding /machine:x64 flag on 64-bit on MSVC

summary.raw:
Avoid hardcoding /machine:x64 flag on 64-bit on MSVC

On MSVC compilers with 64-bit, a /machine:x64 linker flag was manually added to workaround for http://www.cmake.org/Bug/print\_bug\_page.php?bug\_id=11240 . However, that CMake bug was fixed in CMake 3.4, and the minimum version of CMake required by ignition-cmake is 3.5.1, so the workaround can be safely removed. 

Furthermore, now MSVC also supports compiling for ARM64 architecture \(whose linker flag is /machine:ARM64\) so the workaround is currently preventing the compilation of ignition libraries for ARM64 architectures with Visual Studio.
summary.html:
Avoid hardcoding /machine:x64 flag on 64-bit on MSVC

On MSVC compilers with 64-bit, a /machine:x64 linker flag was manually added to workaround for http://www.cmake.org/Bug/print_bug_page.php?bug_id=11240 . However, that CMake bug was fixed in CMake 3.4, and the minimum version of CMake required by ignition-cmake is 3.5.1, so the workaround can be safely removed.

Furthermore, now MSVC also supports compiling for ARM64 architecture (whose linker flag is /machine:ARM64) so the workaround is currently preventing the compilation of ignition libraries for ARM64 architectures with Visual Studio.

values.description:
This PR backports a fix as requested by Issue #67 and should help with a build system issue that arises in Gazebo while using dartsim, as detailed: [https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/issues/2650/catkin-build-cannot-find-tinyxml2-tinyxml2](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/issues/2650/catkin-build-cannot-find-tinyxml2-tinyxml2)

This was fixed in `ign-cmake1`, but the fix was never backported to `ign-cmake0` even though it’s relevant for Gazebo9.
values.title: Backport fix for find_path cache confusion

summary.raw:
This PR backports a fix as requested by Issue #67 and should help with a build system issue that arises in Gazebo while using dartsim, as detailed: [https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/issues/2650/catkin-build-cannot-find-tinyxml2-tinyxml2](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/issues/2650/catkin-build-cannot-find-tinyxml2-tinyxml2)

This was fixed in `ign-cmake1`, but the fix was never backported to `ign-cmake0` even though it’s relevant for Gazebo9.
summary.html:
This PR backports a fix as requested by Issue #67 and should help with a build system issue that arises in Gazebo while using dartsim, as detailed: https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/issues/2650/catkin-build-cannot-find-tinyxml2-tinyxml2

This was fixed in ign-cmake1, but the fix was never backported to ign-cmake0 even though it’s relevant for Gazebo9.

values.description:
Newer versions of CMake make the build incredibly noisy with eg:  

```

CMake Warning (dev) at /home/mjcarroll/workspaces/citadel/build/ignition-cmake3/fake/install/share/cmake/ignition-cmake3/cmake3/IgnUtils.cmake:1241 (target_link_libraries):
  Policy CMP0079 is not set: target_link_libraries allows use with targets in
  other directories.  Run "cmake --help-policy CMP0079" for policy details.
  Use the cmake_policy command to set the policy and suppress this warning.

  Target

    ignition-component_deps-all

  is not created in this directory.  For compatibility with older versions of
  CMake, link library

    ignition-component_deps-parent

  will be looked up in the directory in which the target was created rather
  than in this calling directory.
Call Stack (most recent call first):
  parent/CMakeLists.txt:2 (ign_add_component)
```

‌

My reading/understanding of the docs: [https://cmake.org/cmake/help/latest/policy/CMP0079.html](https://cmake.org/cmake/help/latest/policy/CMP0079.html) would imply that we want to opt into this policy
values.title: Suppress CMP0079 warnings in CMake >= 3.13

  Policy CMP0079 is not set: target_link_libraries allows use with targets in
  other directories.  Run "cmake --help-policy CMP0079" for policy details.
  Use the cmake_policy command to set the policy and suppress this warning.

  Target

  is not created in this directory.  For compatibility with older versions of

‌

My reading/understanding of the docs: https://cmake.org/cmake/help/latest/policy/CMP0079.html would imply that we want to opt into this policy

values.reason: This PR was from a strange place locally, disregard.

values.description:
Seems like with some of the examples inside ign-cmake2 and how they are being tested we are breaking the length limit for cmd on Windows. That was affecting some builds but not the own ign-cmake CI.

This PRs makes some of the names shorter and that seems to have fixed the error.

**Tested:**

Failing physics build:

[https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign\_physics-pr-win/409/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign_physics-pr-win/409/)

Physics with this branch in gazebodistro:

[https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign\_physics-pr-win/410/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign_physics-pr-win/410/)
values.title: [Citadel] Reduce example names to fix build on Windows

summary.raw:
Seems like with some of the examples inside ign-cmake2 and how they are being tested we are breaking the length limit for cmd on Windows. That was affecting some builds but not the own ign-cmake CI.

This PRs makes some of the names shorter and that seems to have fixed the error.

**Tested:**

Failing physics build:

[https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign\_physics-pr-win/409/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign_physics-pr-win/409/)

Physics with this branch in gazebodistro:

[https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign\_physics-pr-win/410/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign_physics-pr-win/410/)

values.description:
[This PR](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-math/pull-requests/342) added equations to the [API documentation](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-math/pull-requests/342/added-gaussmarkovprocess/diff#Linclude/ignition/math/GaussMarkovProcess.hhT110).

Doxygen uses latex by default to render equations. The problem with this is the need to install latex on CI machines. Installation consumes hundreds of MB, which is a bit crazy for CI. Also, mathjax looks better than latex rendered for webpages.

So, this PR enables mathjax, and updates the CDN script link which was acquired from [their documentation](http://docs.mathjax.org/en/latest/web/start.html).
This is what the output looks like:

![math.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/Gg8npGe/images/1033565383-math.png)
values.title: Use mathjax to render equations

values.description:
Fixes #72.

Dependencies of a core library that are marked as PRIVATE in the ign_find_package and target_link_libraries calls are not being marked as Requires.private in the generated pkg-config .pc files; instead they are included as public Requires dependencies. By contrast, dependencies of components marked as PRIVATE_FOR in ign_find_package and PRIVATE in target_link_libraries are properly included in the generated .pc files.

A behavior change in homebrew caused the `libcurl.pc` file to be unavailable, which caused a bottle build failure, since ign-fuel-tools was requiring that, even though curl is a private dependency of fuel-tools. This PR fixes a variable name to ensure that the `Requires` and `Requires.private` variables are set properly for the core library (components were working correctly already).

I added a test as well.
values.title: Ensure private dependencies are encoded in pkgconfig as Requires.private

summary.raw:
Fixes #72.

Dependencies of a core library that are marked as PRIVATE in the ign_find_package and target_link_libraries calls are not being marked as Requires.private in the generated pkg-config .pc files; instead they are included as public Requires dependencies. By contrast, dependencies of components marked as PRIVATE_FOR in ign_find_package and PRIVATE in target_link_libraries are properly included in the generated .pc files.

A behavior change in homebrew caused the `libcurl.pc` file to be unavailable, which caused a bottle build failure, since ign-fuel-tools was requiring that, even though curl is a private dependency of fuel-tools. This PR fixes a variable name to ensure that the `Requires` and `Requires.private` variables are set properly for the core library (components were working correctly already).

I added a test as well.
summary.html:
Fixes #72.

Dependencies of a core library that are marked as PRIVATE in the ign_find_package and target_link_libraries calls are not being marked as Requires.private in the generated pkg-config .pc files; instead they are included as public Requires dependencies. By contrast, dependencies of components marked as PRIVATE_FOR in ign_find_package and PRIVATE in target_link_libraries are properly included in the generated .pc files.

A behavior change in homebrew caused the libcurl.pc file to be unavailable, which caused a bottle build failure, since ign-fuel-tools was requiring that, even though curl is a private dependency of fuel-tools. This PR fixes a variable name to ensure that the Requires and Requires.private variables are set properly for the core library (components were working correctly already).

I added a test as well.
